summary: I love how Arya will never truly be a FM as shown by her keeping Needle or Jon Snows smile and Jon will always be a Stark as...
question: I love how Arya will never truly be a FM as shown by her keeping Needle or Jon Snows smile and Jon will always be a Stark as shown by him choosing Arya over his loyalty to the Nights Watch.

summary: She is so beautifully gorgeous and gracious!!! Emilia Clarke is an amazing and VERY talented actress!!! She is one of the best...
body:
She is so beautifully gorgeous and gracious!!! Emilia Clarke is an amazing and VERY talented actress!!! She is one of the best alongside Lena and Peter!!! She deserves dozens of EMMYs cause it must have been so difficult to perform like that when the scripts you have in your hands are sh it!!! She did an extraordinary job performing the most beautiful, strong and emotional scene of all season 8, speaking in two fake languages (Dothraki and High Valyrian) infront of a green screen or destroying K.L. and feel the fiury for Cersei infront of a green screen as well. So in love and proud of my Queen this season, even in pain and grief she has played fair and with open cards, she said exactly as she felt and never plotted or spoke against anyone!!! Daenerys proved that being in pain or grief and expressing it is better than go behind backs and plot!!! Daenerys Stormborn of House Targaryen is one the victims of Dan Weiss and David Benioff in the Game of Thrones TV Series!!! She did nothing wrong and even if she would do something like that (burning innocents) I am sure George R.R. Martin is going to write it better and make us feel it right.

P.s.: And I am sure GRRM doesn’t want us to see Sansa and Bran as the oathbreakers and plotter they were in this sh it season. And I don’t think he want us to see one of his favourites, Daenerys, burning innocents just because!!! I am sure he is sad of the way his character ended!!!

summary: Fixing Jon’s character is real hard work. I have to justify his past actions in Season 8 and to show the real consequences of...
body: Fixing Jon’s character is real hard work. I have to justify his past actions in Season 8 and to show the real consequences of what happened to him and to show his state of mind and to answer a lot of questions regarding Daenerys, the R+L=J reveal and to make it all realistic and believable and of course, I have to say all that in the course of the story so that it looks natural and not like a summary - trust me guys, that’s hard. But I guess I did it. It took the form of a 16-page chapter but I guess I did it. I only hope that it’ll be consistent enough

summary: When jon is resurrected, what do you think other people’s reactions to him will be? It was just brushed off in the show, which...
question: When jon is resurrected, what do you think other people’s reactions to him will be? It was just brushed off in the show, which didn’t seem realistic
answer:
I think there will be a lot of confusion, generated mostly by different reports. A good reference would be the smallfolk’s tales about Beric Dondarrion.

There was always talk of Beric Dondarrion. A fat archer once said the Bloody Mummers had slain him, but the others only laughed. “Lorch killed the man at Rushing Falls, and the Mountain’s slain him twice. Got me a silver stag says he don’t stay dead this time neither.” (Arya VII, ACOK)

“A wound,” said Lem Lemoncloak. “A grievous wound, aye, but Thoros healed it. There’s never been no better healer.”

[…]

“Even brave men blind themselves sometimes, when they are afraid to see,” Lord Beric said when Lem was gone. “Thoros, how many times have you brought me back now?” (Arya VII, ASOS)

Some people will deny Jon ever died, because how could he have? He’s up and walking around, so whatever story they heard about him getting stabbed must have been an exaggeration, or even an outright lie. These people will likely be Stannis’ men, distant members of the Watch, some secluded wildlings, and probably most everyone who isn’t on the Wall.

Then there will be those who know for certain Jon was dead, who either saw his body or saw his murder, and put two and two together. Reactions here will be rightfully mixed, especially among the Night’s Watch and the Wildlings. More hostile parties will accuse him of being an Other or a wight, though they won’t be able to explain how he’s still talking, and will try to use it against him. Realistically, the overwhelming response will be based on fear, likely creating a large (or rather, larger) divide between the masses.

I can also see a deal of people staying on Jon’s good side because of a mixture of fear and awe, though. Tormund, for example, will probably defend him and even talk him up. For many, Jon would turn into a legend or an icon (depending on how they view magic), a powerful and frightening figurehead.

To summarize, I would say the reaction to Jon’s resurrection will be vitally mixed, the result of a phenomena that is twisted and altered as it passes through word of mouth. Is he a wight? The antithesis to a wight? Opinions vary, and the end result is everyone hearing a rumor and no one agreeing on it.

title: Jon's Rant (aka Sam woke the dragon) - LAStoryWriterAlex - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Chapters: 1/1
Fandom: Game of Thrones (TV)
Rating: Mature
Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
Relationships: Jon Snow/Daenerys Targaryen
Characters: Jon Snow | Aegon Targaryen, Jon Snow, Samwell Tarly, Daenerys Targaryen
Additional Tags: only rated mature for language, no smut or anything sorry guys, not for fans of Sam!, Sorry Not Sorry, Canon Compliant, Season 8, Sam wakes the dragon, “Would she do the same”, fuck that, Of course she would, and Jon lets Sam know
Summary:

What Jon should have said after Sam asked him, “Would [Daenerys] do the same?”

This was very cathartic to write. Hope it’s cathartic for you guys to read.

blog.description: An art blog dedicated to the Mother of Dragons. Because admit it, she has a bunch of arts/illustrations/images everywhere and they need their own gallery. May include fan arts of other ASOIAF/GOT characters and other stuffs.</br>*Portrait by KLSteeleheart</br>*Header by Marc Simonetti

summary: Jon Snow Vs Drogon by Mizuri Official Dragons are not so easy to kill as that. Tickle him with these and you'll only make him...
caption:
Jon Snow Vs Drogon by Mizuri Official

Dragons are not so easy to kill as that. Tickle him with these and you’ll only make him angry.

The eyes were where a dragon was most vulnerable. The eyes, and the brain behind them. Not the underbelly, as certain old tales would have it. The scales there were just as tough as those along a dragon’s back and flanks. And not down the gullet either. That was madness. These would-be dragonslayers might as well try to quench a fire with a spear thrust. “Death comes out of the dragon’s mouth,” Septon Barth had written in his Unnatural History, “but death does not go in that way.”
